column1: Rhosgobel was the "old home" of Radagast. The house is said to have been located between the Carrock and the Old Forest Road
column2: on the western borders of Mirkwood
column3: Note 4 and near its southern borders.
column4: p.305This location for Rhosgobel appears on the first map of The Lord of the Rings in The Treason of Isengard. A dot and the name are near the center of square L-13 on Map II
column5: placing Rhosgobel east and a little south of the Gladden Fields.

column2: some scouts from Rivendell passed over the Misty Mountains and eventually came to Rhosgobel
column3: but they found that Radagast was not there.

column4: p. 241 is evidently a compound of rhosc ("brown") and gobel ("walled house or village
column6: 385 The name of the house was perhaps a reference to its resident

column3: is given of Rhosgobel. It is built around a large furry oak tree.

column1: 2011: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game:
: Rhosgobel is depicted as a u-shaped wooden house nestled in the woods surrounding a small blue pool of water or pond.
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene
column2: when it is attacked by spiders. Radagast later discovers that these spiders came from Dol Guldur.

column1: 2014: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies:
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene
column2: when Radagast takes Gandalf from Dol Guldur to Rhosgobel after alerting the White Council to his presence there.
